Keras: Classify Binary¶

Reference this great blog for machine learning cookbooks: MachineLearningMastery.com “Binary Classification”.

[1]:

import keras
from keras.models import Sequential
from keras.layers import Dense, Dropout
from keras.callbacks import History

from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelBinarizer, PowerTransformer

import aiqc
from aiqc import datum

Example Data¶

Reference Example Datasets for more information.

[2]:

df = datum.to_pandas('sonar.csv')

df.head()

a) High-Level API¶

Reference High-Level API Docs for more information including how to work with non-tabular data.

[4]:

splitset = aiqc.Pipeline.Tabular.make(
    dataFrame_or_filePath = df
    , label_column = 'object'
    , size_test = 0.22
    , size_validation = 0.12
    , label_encoder = LabelBinarizer(sparse_output=False)
    , feature_encoders = [{
        "sklearn_preprocess": PowerTransformer(method='yeo-johnson', copy=False)
        , "dtypes": ['float64']
    }]

    , dtype = None
    , features_excluded = None
    , fold_count = None
    , bin_count = None
)

[5]:

def fn_build(features_shape, label_shape, **hp):
    model = Sequential(name='Sonar')
    model.add(Dense(hp['neuron_count'], activation='relu', kernel_initializer='he_uniform'))
    model.add(Dropout(0.30))
    model.add(Dense(hp['neuron_count'], activation='relu', kernel_initializer='he_uniform'))
    model.add(Dropout(0.30))
    model.add(Dense(hp['neuron_count'], activation='relu', kernel_initializer='he_uniform'))
    model.add(Dense(units=label_shape[0], activation='sigmoid', kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform'))
    return model

[6]:

def fn_train(model, loser, optimizer, samples_train, samples_evaluate, **hp):
    model.compile(
        loss=loser
        , optimizer=optimizer
        , metrics=['accuracy']
    )
    model.fit(
        samples_train['features'], samples_train['labels']
        , validation_data = (samples_evaluate['features'], samples_evaluate['labels'])
        , verbose = 0
        , batch_size = 3
        , epochs = hp['epochs']
        , callbacks = [History()]
    )
    return model

[7]:

hyperparameters = {
    "neuron_count": [25, 50]
    , "epochs": [75, 150]
}

[8]:

queue = aiqc.Experiment.make(
    library = "keras"
    , analysis_type = "classification_binary"
    , fn_build = fn_build
    , fn_train = fn_train
    , splitset_id = splitset.id
    , encoderset_id = splitset.encodersets[0]
    , repeat_count = 2
    , hide_test = False
    , hyperparameters = hyperparameters

    , fn_lose = None #automated
    , fn_optimize = None #automated
    , fn_predict = None #automated
    , foldset_id = None
)

[9]:

queue.run_jobs()

🔮 Training Models 🔮: 100%|██████████████████████████████████████████| 8/8 [01:21<00:00, 10.22s/it]

For more information on visualization of performance metrics, reference the Visualization & Metrics documentation.

b) Low-Level API¶

Reference Low-Level API Docs for more information including how to work with non-tabular data and defining optimizers.

[10]:

dataset = aiqc.Dataset.Tabular.from_pandas(df)

[11]:

label_column = 'object'

[12]:

label = dataset.make_label(columns=[label_column])

[13]:

featureset = dataset.make_featureset(exclude_columns=[label_column])

[14]:

splitset = featureset.make_splitset(
    label_id = label.id
    , size_test = 0.22
    , size_validation = 0.12
)

[15]:

encoderset = splitset.make_encoderset()

[16]:

labelcoder = encoderset.make_labelcoder(
    sklearn_preprocess = LabelBinarizer(sparse_output=False)
)

[17]:

featurecoder_0 = encoderset.make_featurecoder(
    sklearn_preprocess = PowerTransformer(method='yeo-johnson', copy=False)
    , dtypes = ['float64']
)

[18]:

def fn_build(features_shape, label_shape, **hp):
    model = Sequential(name='Sonar')
    model.add(Dense(hp['neuron_count'], activation='relu', kernel_initializer='he_uniform'))
    model.add(Dropout(0.30))
    model.add(Dense(hp['neuron_count'], activation='relu', kernel_initializer='he_uniform'))
    model.add(Dropout(0.30))
    model.add(Dense(hp['neuron_count'], activation='relu', kernel_initializer='he_uniform'))
    model.add(Dense(units=label_shape[0], activation='sigmoid', kernel_initializer='glorot_uniform'))
    return model

[19]:

def fn_train(model, loser, optimizer, samples_train, samples_evaluate, **hp):
    model.compile(
        loss=loser
        , optimizer=optimizer
        , metrics=['accuracy']
    )
    model.fit(
        samples_train['features'], samples_train['labels']
        , validation_data = (samples_evaluate['features'], samples_evaluate['labels'])
        , verbose = 0
        , batch_size = 3
        , epochs = hp['epochs']
        , callbacks = [History()]
    )
    return model

[20]:

algorithm = aiqc.Algorithm.make(
    library = "keras"
    , analysis_type = "classification_binary"
    , fn_build = fn_build
    , fn_train = fn_train
)

[21]:

hyperparameters = {
    "neuron_count": [25, 50]
    , "epochs": [75, 150]
}

[22]:

hyperparamset = algorithm.make_hyperparamset(
    hyperparameters = hyperparameters
)

[23]:

queue = algorithm.make_queue(
    splitset_id = splitset.id
    , hyperparamset_id = hyperparamset.id
    , encoderset_id  = encoderset.id
    , repeat_count = 2
)

[24]:

queue.run_jobs()

🔮 Training Models 🔮: 100%|██████████████████████████████████████████| 8/8 [01:22<00:00, 10.25s/it]

For more information on visualization of performance metrics, reference the Visualization & Metrics documentation.
